item.title: As Gambia weighs end to genital-cutting ban, this girl was cut behind mother’s back
item.dc:creator: Rachel Chason
item.description: The West African country could become the first in the world to overturn a prohibition on female genital cutting.

item.title: Israeli strikes targeting Hamas military leader kill 90 in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Hajar Harb, Jonathan Baran, Louisa Loveluck, Victoria Bisset
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Saturday that “there is still no absolute certainty” that Mohammed Deif was killed.

item.title: Who is Mohammed Deif, Hamas military commander targeted by Israel?
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall
item.description: Israel’s military says it targeted Mohammed Deif, the commander of Hamas’s military wing, in a strike Saturday.

item.title: Princess Kate will present trophy to men’s Wimbledon winner, palace says
item.dc:creator: Dan Rosenzweig-Ziff
item.description: It would be the second public appearance for Catherine, Princess of Wales, since announcing that she has cancer.

item.title: These are Hamas’s top leaders
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch, Cate Brown, Sammy Westfall
item.description: The group has both a political and military wing. Some of its leaders are public figures while others operate in the shadows.

item.title: Asia’s richest man is hosting a ‘spectacular,’ ‘vulgar,’ star-studded wedding
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Anant Ambani, Mukesh Ambani’s son, has married Radhika Merchant. Here’s what to know about the glitzy, glamorous and controversial wedding in Mumbai.

item.title: Germany is forcing some asylum seekers to work, when they just want real jobs
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: Germany’s debate over migrants and jobs comes against the backdrop of an economy in desperate need of new workers as the population ages.

item.title: Taliban tries reconciling science and religion in facing climate change
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: Afghanistan’s rulers, cut off from foreign assistance, are tackling climate change on their own while debating whether it is God’s doing or a foreign plot.

item.title: Israel, Hamas inch closer to Gaza cease-fire deal, but gaps remain
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung
item.description: Officials said that while Israel and Hamas appear closer to a cease-fire deal, new Israeli demands and disagreements over details are still at issue.

item.title: After abuse revelations, professors grapple with how to teach Munro
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta
item.description: Alice Munro, Canada’s only Nobel laureate in literature, stayed with her husband after he admitted abusing her daughter. Canadians are now reassessing a national icon.

item.title: After weeks of protests, Kenya’s president sacks his much reviled ministers
item.dc:creator: Katharine Houreld, Rael Ombuor
item.description: Just six weeks ago, President William Ruto was visiting the White House and basking as a top U.S. ally in Africa, but Kenya has since exploded with anti-corruption protests.
